newsitem.title: USA: Osteotech sees 97 profit from restructuring.
newsitem.headline: Osteotech sees 97 profit from restructuring.

text.p: Osteotech Inc said Monday it will discontinue its PolyActive polymer research program in a restructuring that should return the company to profitability in the first half of 1997.
Osteotech said it expects the restructuring of its Netherlands operations to make those operations profitable in the first half of 1997.
The company said the restructuring will not affect its revenue base but should save about $1 million a year in expenses.
Excluding restructuring charges, Osteotech said it continues to expect a pretax profit of more than the $1.653 million reported in 1995.
Osteotech reported earnings of $0.02 per share in the second quarter, compared to a $0.10 per share loss in the year-ago period.
The company said it expects to see a fourth quarter pretax charge of about $1.35 million from the restructuring.
Ostetech said its Netherlands division has incurred pretax losses each year since Osteotech acquired them in May 1992.
The losses include $1.384 million in the year ended December 31, 1995, and a pretax loss of $721,000 in the six-months ended June 30, 1996, Osteotech said.
As a result of the restructuring, the company said, it is immediately discontinuing OsteoActive Bone Void Filler, its lead product in the polymer research and development program.

Osteotech said it intends to focus its efforts on its revenue-producing ceramic and titanium plasma spray coating services and ceramic powders and products, which are used by orthopedic and dental implant companies.
